bug.author: dongju-chae
bug.description:
gst-inspect shows a list of subplugins described in .ini file. However, it may show duplicated subplugins when there are multiple sources of .ini files. Initial states <denchmark-code>$ dchae@dchae-ubuntu:~$ gst-inspect-1.0 tensor_filter | grep sub-plugins -n2 98- flags: readable, writable 99- String. Default: null 100: sub-plugins : Registrable sub-plugins list 101- flags: readable 102- String. Default: "custom,custom-easy" </denchmark-code>
After copying tflite subplugin <denchmark-code>dchae@dchae-ubuntu:~$ sudo cp libnnstreamer_filter_tensorflow-lite.so /usr/lib/nnstreamer/filters/ dchae@dchae-ubuntu:~$ gst-inspect-1.0 tensor_filter | grep sub-plugins -n2 98- flags: readable, writable 99- String. Default: null 100: sub-plugins : Registrable sub-plugins list 101- flags: readable 102- String. Default: "custom,custom-easy,tensorflow-lite,tensorflow-lite" </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/2057>#2057</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.
